verbs.description: beglamour (third-person singular simple present beglamours, present participle beglamouring, simple past and past participle beglamoured)

examples: In her former blindness she had known him as shiftless Johnny Taylor, tall and lean. That was before the golden dust of pollen had beglamored his rags and her eyes.

entries.meaning: To bedazzle; to deceive as if by magic.
examples: “Do,” cried Robin; “sir, she’s an auld withered hag, would spean a foal. Surely she did na sae beglamour your senses as to appear like a winsome young lass?”
